verses.verse: WOE to you that plunder, but you shall not plunder, and let no one deal treacherously among you; for when you seek to plunder, they will plunder you; and when you seek to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with you.
O LORD, be gracious to us; for in thee is our trust; be thou our helper every morning, our salvation also in the time of distress.
At the noise of thy tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
Henceforth your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpillar; as a swarm of locusts when it is gathered together.
The LORD is exalted, for he dwells on high; he has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
And faith shall be the stability of your times, and your salvation in a place of refuge; wisdom and knowledge and the reverence of the LORD is his treasure.
If he should be seen by them they shall howl violently; the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceases, and the covenant is broken; the cities are despised, and there is no regard for man.
The earth mourns and languishes; Lebanon is ashamed and confounded; Sharon has become like a desert plain; and Bashan and Carmel are desolate.
Now I will arise, says the LORD; now I will be exalted; now I will lift up myself.
You shall conceive thorns, you shall bring forth stubble; your breath, as fire, shall devour you.
And the peoples shall be as the burning of lime; as thorns that are gathered together shall they be burned in the fire.
Hear, you who are far off, what I have clone; and you who are near, acknowledge my might.
The sinners in Zion are afraid; trembling has seized the heathen. Who among us shall dwell with devouring fire? Who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

He who walks righteously and speaks uprightly; he who despises treachery and oppression, who refuses to accept a bribe, who stops his ears that he may not hear of bloodshed, and shuts his eyes that he may not see evil.
He shall dwell on high; his place of defense shall be the precipice of rocks; his bread shall be given him; his water shall be sure.
Your eyes shall see the king in his beauty; they shall behold the lands that are far off.
Your heart shall learn reverence. Where is the scribe? Where is the weigher? Where is he who counted towers for a mighty people?
You shall not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech, of a stammering tongue, so that he cannot be understood.

Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities; your eyes shall see Jerusalem a rich habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be shaken to and fro; whose pegs shall never be removed, neither shall any of its cords be broken.

For there the name of the LORD is glorious to us; he will be for us a place of light, an enlightenment, and an open space made by the hand; wherein the authority of a prince shall not reign, neither shall the mighty one be able to invade it.
For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; and he is our Saviour.
Your riggings are loosed; they could not well hold straight their mast, they could not spread the sail; until they have divided the prey, a multitude of lame shall take it.
And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick; the people who dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
